issues.title: Clinical Issues Extraction
issues.description: Used to identify distinct clinical issues from the transcript
issues.prompt:
Read the clinical scenario below
List the significant issues as brief, single-line statements. 
When multiple issues might be related by a clinical entity, combine them into one concise issue. 
Each issue must be 60 characters or fewer. 
Please ensure the list of issues isn't numbered.
Please ensure there isn't a trailing full stop at the end of each issue
Please only generate 2-3 issues for most patients.
For complex patients, perhaps 5 issues, for very complex patients 7. 
Use medical words where possible. 

Clinical Scenario:
{{text}}

guidelines.title: Guidelines Selection
guidelines.description: Used to select relevant guidelines for each clinical issue
guidelines.prompt:
Please identify ONLY the guidelines that DIRECTLY address the management of this specific clinical issue. The guidelines must contain specific recommendations or protocols for managing this exact condition.

Rules:
- Select ONLY guidelines the most relevant 1 or 2 guidelines that have this issue as their primary focus
- EXCLUDE guidelines that only mention the issue in passing
- EXCLUDE guidelines that focus on different conditions
- Return ONLY the exact filenames of relevant guidelines
- List each filename on a new line
- Do not add any additional text or explanations

For example, for 'Previous Caesarean Section', ONLY return guidelines specifically about VBAC or birth after caesarean.
For 'Obesity in Pregnancy', ONLY return guidelines specifically about managing obesity in pregnancy.

Issue: {{text}}

Available guidelines:
{{guidelines}}

clinicalNote.title: Clinical Note Generation
clinicalNote.description: Used to generate the final clinical note
clinicalNote.prompt:
Please write a concise clinical note using medical terminology, based solely on the clinical transcript provided below. Do not invent or assume any details that are not explicitly mentioned in the transcript.

The output should be in 3 sectiions - the first should be a simple summary of the presentation in bullet points, each point on a new line, including age, presenting complaint(s), and if relevant things like previous pregnancies (or lack thereof) and BMI, then there should be a newline, then the middle section should be the 'body' of the note describing each issue in more detail with the appropriate context and the associated advice from the doctor, then a newline, then the plan: first write 'Plan:' and then, from a new line, a numbered list of the management steps anticipated

Rules:
- Use professional medical terminology.
- Use one sentence per line.
- Only include details that are directly mentioned in the transcript

Clinical transcript:
{{text}}

applyGuideline.title: Apply Guideline to Clinical Situation
applyGuideline.description: Used to apply a clinical guideline to a specific clinical situation
applyGuideline.prompt:
I would like you to apply the attached clinical guideline to the following clinical situation.

Your response should include the following, where appropriate:
1. Further information needed - list what additional information is needed and why
2. Proposed management according to the guideline
3. Benefits of the proposed approach
4. Risks of the proposed approach
5. Alternative approaches

Guideline:
{{guideline}}

Clinical situation:
{{situation}}

testTranscript.title: Test Transcript Generation
testTranscript.description: Used to generate fictional test transcripts for development and testing
testTranscript.prompt:
Create a fictional dictation of a clinical interaction between a healthcare professional and a patient. 
This dictation is for testing purposes only and should include various topics that might be discussed in a healthcare setting. 
Please ensure the material is entirely fictional and does not provide any real medical advice or information. 
The scenario should cover 2 complex obstetric or 2 complex gynaecological issues.
Please ensure variables such as age, weight and history are varied.
The clinician should ensure a comprehensive history, including age, weight (expressed as both kg and BMI), presenting complaint, history of presenting complaint, past medical, surgical and gynaecological history, drug history, allergy history, social history (including occupation) as well as the patient's ideas, concerns and expectations.
The clinican should explain the examination findings (the type of examination would be determined by the history).
In response to their history and examination findings, the clinician should  provide specific management advice and guidance.

crossCheck.title: Cross-Check Clinical Note Against Guidelines
crossCheck.description: Used to validate a clinical note against provided guidelines
crossCheck.prompt: You are provided with the text of a clinical note from a patient encounter and a set of clinical guidelines. Your task is to: 1. Cross-check the clinical note against each provided guideline: 2. Identify areas in the clinical note that do not fully adhere to the guideline recommendations. 3. Note any parts of the note that could be improved based on the guidelines. Include the full text of each guideline in your response: 4. For every guideline you reference, include its complete text. 5. Next to each suggested change, provide a short reference to the guideline (e.g., the guideline's name or identifier). 6. Return the clinical note as HTML-formatted code: The clinical note should be output as valid HTML. Any text in the clinical note that has been adjusted or needs adjustment (in light of the guidelines) should be wrapped in tags (to display in italics). Ensure that the guideline reference appears immediately following the italicized adjustment for clarity. Your final output should therefore contain: The complete text of each guideline used, with clear references. The HTML-formatted clinical note where adjustments appear in italics with the respective guideline reference. For example, in the following clinical note text: Summary: Patient presents with irregular menstrual cycles, intense cramps, and heavier flow, raising concerns for underlying conditions. Body: Patient reports irregular menstrual cycles, increased cramps, and heavier flow. No history of ovarian cysts or endometriosis. Further investigation with pelvic exam and imaging studies is warranted. Perform pelvic exam to assess reproductive organs. Consider imaging studies for detailed evaluation. Discuss family planning goals and contraceptive needs. Collaborate to determine the most appropriate management approach. An adjustement in light of this guideline (Endometriosis: diagnosis and management NICE guideline - https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/ng73) would be to this sentence Further investigation with pelvic exam and imaging studies is warranted. A family history of endometriosis would make the diagnosis more likely (Endometriosis: diagnosis and management NICE guideline) Here is the note text: {{text}} Here is each guideline with the title followed by the guideline: {{guidelines}}
